data.title: What Can AI Do?
data.body: Artificial Intelligence, or AI, is when computers try to think and learn like people. AI can understand voices, play games, and even help drive cars! It learns from lots of examples. For example, to learn what a dog looks like, AI looks at many dog pictures. Then it tries to guess if a new picture is a dog. Just like we get better by practicing, AI also improves by learning from mistakes!

data.title: How AI Makes Decisions
data.body: AI systems learn by looking at large amounts of data and finding patterns. For example, an AI can learn to spot spam emails by studying thousands of real emails. Once trained, the AI can make decisions on its own, like which emails go to the inbox and which ones go to the spam folder. The more examples AI sees, the better it becomes at making accurate choices.

data.title: Ethics in Artificial Intelligence
data.body: As AI systems become more advanced, it's important to consider how they are used. For example, should AI be used to monitor people through surveillance cameras? Should it decide who gets a job or a loan? These decisions must be fair and unbiased. Ethics in AI means thinking about what is right and wrong when designing and using these systems, so they help people and do not cause harm.
